titleStmt.title: Thank you note for Christmas gifts to the Old Folks Home
titleStmt.author: (Likely) Eartha M. M. White

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: Author thanks recipients for Christmas gifts sent to the Old Folks home.

objectDesc.p: This is a handwritten letter written on the folded stationary of Eartha M. M. White with writing on both sides. It is accompanied by a photograph of an event.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

body.p:
The Old Folks Home was
Enjoyedenjoyed a Merrymerry Christmas

Two days before Christmas a splendid
programeprogram was rendered by the Studentsstudents
of the Boylan 2nd.Second School who gave each
of the inmates a box of candy and
a bushellbushel of sweet potatoes. and
Christmas Eve, Thethe Federated clubsClubs of
the city under the leadership of
Mr. Garfield and Mr. Brown accomplished
a Motor Cademotorcade to the Home where
a splendid programeprogram was rendered
Afterafter by Mrs. Richardson. Miss
the secretary introducedcalled on Mr. Jas.James H. James

who in an elocquelenteloquent address that
touched the hearts of all present the
very latest thing in a Radioradio costing
over a hundred dollars and presented
a receitedreceipted bill accompaingaccompanying the Radioradio.
The Oldold people were made happy to
to the extreemextreme. Some had never heard
or seen a radio. eachEach had to express
their joy and thanks; this brought
tears to the eyes of those present. oneOne
old Manman, over one hundred, express his
thanks in a prayprayer asking God's blessing
upon all who made it possible. Miss
Eartha M.M. White Thethe president and Mrs.
Martha Green the Sectysecretary accepted the radio with (over)

thanks inbehalfin behalf of the Institutioninstitution.
Its officers and members and
Thethe Oldold folks.
Others who contribubutedcontributed
Sheriff W. B. Cohoon $5.00
St Paul Junior choir sang charolscarols and a basket
of groceries and cash $1.10
The Wade-Farris Cold Storage CoCompany —
1 barrellbarrel of lights and 75 lbs brome
Mr. Richard Anderson — 11 per Sockssocks, 22 per Hoeshoes.
Mr. Walter Hawkins — 50 oranges.
Daughter Elks through Mrs. Hattie Williams —
a box with new garments of each person
Mrs. Amanda Coleman — 12 bath towellstowels-, 11 face towellstowels

Stanton High School 10 grade DivDivision B — groceries
Jolly Boys and Girls, A.E. Davis, chairman —
2 chickens, a new suit of clothing
From the Daughters and Brothers of Elks, — groceries
The Jolly 12 Social Club — 1 crate mixed fruits
Mr. S. W. Faine — 15 lbs fish
Mrs. S. S. Goffin - a large fruit cake, 2 galgallons
grape fruit juice, oranges, candy, and flowers,
Mrs. Rosa Pleasant — 14 pies
The DayLight Grocery — apples
Mr. Isaac Lewis of Mayport — 1/2 bar fish
forFor these and all other gifts,
we wish to thank yo all.
